p: DF continues to be one of the most common vector borne diseases in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the world [ 4, 5]. Every year, around 390 million people are infected globally, of which around 96 million manifest clinically with varying severity [ 5]. South East (SE) Asia and Western Pacific countries represent about 75% of the burden, and epidemics are experienced every 3â€“5 years in these regions [ 6].
